featured.title: Sónar Festival Announces First 31 Names For 33rd Edition
featured.description: *Featured Cover Image Courtesy: Sónar Festival/Sónar+D Sónar Festival has just announced the first 31 names in the lineup for its 33rd edition, set to take place in Barcelona on the weekend of June 18-20, 2026. This year’s program showcases an exceptional mix of prominent artists, influential figures, and groundbreaking emerging talents that define
featured.fullContent:
*Featured Cover Image Courtesy: Sónar Festival/Sónar+D

Sónar Festival has just announced the first 31 names in the lineup for its 33rd edition, set to take place in Barcelona on the weekend of June 18-20, 2026. This year’s program showcases an exceptional mix of prominent artists, influential figures, and groundbreaking emerging talents that define contemporary electronic culture. As for the 31 artists that Sónar Festival have announced who will perform there, those artists are just 33 percent of the full artist lineup that the festival will finalize very soon.

The first artists announced for the 33rd edition Sónar Festival

The festival will feature electrifying performances by renowned artists such as Kelis, celebrated for her genre-defying hits; Skepta, a leading figure in the UK grime scene; and Charlotte de Witte, widely recognized for her electrifying techno sets. Attendees can look forward to another standout lineup that includes Amelie Lens, Modeselektor, Cabaret Voltaire, Nia Archives, and the due of Julianna Barwick and Mary Lattimore.

Additionally, the lineup features the Danish electronic band WhoMadeWho, the avant-garde sounds of Ascendant Vierge, and the emerging act 30drop. Renowned DJs such as Chris Stussy, Sammy Virji, DJ Gigola, Kettama, Joy Orbison, Boys Noize, Ogazón, ISA, and an upcoming B2B set of Clementaum and LAZA will also deliver unforgettable performances, ensuring a rich and diverse experience for festival-goers.

The Fira Gran Via will be the sole venue of the festival’s 33rd edition

Sónar+D will not only maintain its presence in Barcelona but will also expand its influence within the musical programming at the Fira Gran Via. This wonderful growth of Sónar+D will elevate the festival experience even further through immersive installations, cutting-edge digital art exhibits, and engaging interactive elements that encourage attendee participation. Details about the discourse and networking program, which will facilitate valuable connections among industry professionals in a city center venue, will be announced soon.

The newly launched SonarImage campaign, developed by the innovative Boldtron studio, positions the festival as a dynamic and evolving entity, akin to a living organism in constant transition. This concept powerfully reflects Sónar’s commitment to innovation and experimentation in the electronic music landscape. A captivating video showcasing this campaign is available for viewing here.

How to get the tickets

In a strong commitment to accessibility, Sónar and Sónar+D will provide a variety of affordable ticket options for all audiences. Importantly, following this initial lineup announcement, the prices for both SonarPass and SonarPass+D will remain stable, ensuring that everyone can partake in this incredible event. Additional ticket types will be made available for purchase in the coming weeks. Sónar Festival will host a memorable celebration of music and creativity.

The post Sónar Festival Announces First 31 Names For 33rd Edition appeared first on EDMTunes.

featured.title: Creamfields Asia Cancelled Less Than a Month Out
featured.description: Edition was Set to Feature a Stellar Roster Comprising the likes of Calvin Harris, Skrillex, Steve Angello & others Creamfields in Asia dream is officially over, albeit might be for the time being as per the organizers. The UK festival was scheduled to debut its Thailand edition on the 13th & 14th December at Muang […] The post Creamfields Asia Can
featured.fullContent:
Edition was Set to Feature a Stellar Roster Comprising the likes of Calvin Harris, Skrillex, Steve Angello & others

Creamfields in Asia dream is officially over, albeit might be for the time being as per the organizers. The UK festival was scheduled to debut its Thailand edition on the 13th & 14th December at Muang Thong Thani in Bangkok. In partnership with Live Nation Electronic Asia, Live Nation Tero, UTA Venture and Nation Group, the festival was rumored to oversee a capacity of 50,000 spanning four stages. The arrival was supposed to elevate the stakes for Southeast Asia’s swelling market for dance music. Not anymore!

As per the organizers, ‘challenges that prevent us from delivering the experience our fans deserve’ has been summarized as the official cause. More than forty artists were supposed to grace the four stages over two nights. An impressive headline roster that included the likes of Calvin Harris, Skrillex, Steve Angello, Camelphat and others. The legendary Anjunadeep & Anjunabeats stages were also supposed to appear with mainstays of both labels scheduled to perform.

All ticket holders will be receiving a full refund ‘via their original payment method’ as per the official statement. Reddit was also abuzz with this development, with many patrons ruing the change of plans for travel, stay, etc. Many also presumed the ticket sales not meeting likely expectations being the primary reason for this eventual fate.

Organizers remain hopeful for the future though, with the official statement also mentioning ‘we look forward to welcoming you to one of our future events soon’!

The post Creamfields Asia Cancelled Less Than a Month Out appeared first on EDMTunes.

featured.title: Framework Launches re:frame LA Event Series
featured.description: Framework, one of the world’s leading independent purveyors of underground music experiences, has unveiled the season calendar for its latest event concept: re:frame. The inaugural series will unfold within Reframe Studios, a state-of-the-art soundstage in Atwater Village that will, for the very first time, be transformed into an innovative, large-
featured.fullContent:
Framework, one of the world’s leading independent purveyors of underground music experiences, has unveiled the season calendar for its latest event concept: re:frame. The inaugural series will unfold within Reframe Studios, a state-of-the-art soundstage in Atwater Village that will, for the very first time, be transformed into an innovative, large-scale nightclub experience. Leveraging the studio’s controlled interior environment, Framework’s re:frame series will pair custom-built audio and visual production to accompany headlining performances from some of the world’s top house and techno artists – a sparkling addition to Framework’s portfolio that further cements the LA-based company as a driving force in the city’s cultural landscape.

Framework, renowned for producing expansive outdoor concerts in distinctive locations across Los Angeles, will debut the exterior grounds of Reframe Studios on Saturday, November 29, 2025, with a headlining performance from Diynamic-label boss Solomun. The event will mark the grand finale of Framework’s 2025 Outdoor Season.

Then, on Friday, January 16, 2026, Framework will transition to Reframe Studios’ indoor space to officially launch the re:frame series, kicking off the Grand Opening with a headlining set from Billboard-charting artist MK and support from Jaden Thompson. The following week, on Saturday, January 24, Italian-born duo Mind Against will bring their swirling techno sounds to the Reframe Studios dancefloor with support from Enamour.

On Friday, January 30, Disco Dom – the disco-focused alter-ego of French producer Dombresky – will headline the third night of Framework presents re:frame, which will also feature support from Maesic. The very next evening, on Saturday, January 31, Dombresky will return to re:frame under his primary alias for another headlining performance, following a support set from Fallon.

The following weekend promises two more nights of electrifying dance music: Friday, February 6 will see British DJ/production duo CamelPhat take the stage at re:frame to present their Experience show, with a support performance from Kotier. On Saturday, February 7, Bronx selectors The Martinez Brothers present Orbita will headline with support from Bontan.

Then, on Friday, February 13, re:frame will feature a headlining set from Berlin-based techno producer/vocalist Jan Blomqvist, with support from Maxi Merakib2b Nico De Andrea and Yulia Niko.

Pre-sale begins this Thursday, November 20 @ 10am PT before general on-sale begins same day at 12pm PT

‘Framework presents re:frame’ season calendar 

1/16/26 (Grand Opening) – MK

1/24/26 – Mind Against

1/30/26 – Disco Dom

1/31/26 – Dombresky

2/6/26 – CamelPhat

2/7/26 – The Martinez Brothers

2/13/26 – Jan Blomqvist

The post Framework Launches re:frame LA Event Series appeared first on EDMTunes.

items.title: Tomorrowland Unleashes Second Novel, ‘The Sky of Sacrifice’
items.description: The saga that began with the international bestseller, The Great Library of Tomorrow, continues! Tomorrowland has announced the release of the second book in its gripping fantasy trilogy: The Sky of Sacrifice. For fans who live and breathe the intricate mythology and thematic depth of the festival, this book is essential reading. The Sky of […] The
items.fullContent:
The saga that began with the international bestseller, The Great Library of Tomorrow, continues! Tomorrowland has announced the release of the second book in its gripping fantasy trilogy: The Sky of Sacrifice.

For fans who live and breathe the intricate mythology and thematic depth of the festival, this book is essential reading. The Sky of Sacrifice plunges readers back into the magical realms first introduced in The Great Library of Tomorrow, escalating the central conflict. The new installment explores deep themes of trust and consequence. It’s forcing characters to confront harsh choices where secrets lead to sacrifice and long-standing friendships are tested.

Much like the meticulously crafted stages and immersive experience of the festival itself, the Tomorrowland Trilogy extends the imaginative universe far beyond the main stage. The books provide a rich, narrative backbone to the themes of unity and adventure that define the entire Tomorrowland brand.

This second chapter promises to be an epic fantasy journey. It further cementing Tomorrowland’s identity not just as a music festival, but as a gateway to an entirely new, fully realized cultural world.

The book is available now. Step back into the magical realms and secure your copy HERE!

The Sky of Sacrifice official description

From the ingenious creators of the Tomorrowland festival comes The Sky of Sacrifice, a highly anticipated follow-up to The Great Library of Tomorrow, the epic first volume in the Book of Wisdom Trilogy.

When secrets arise, friendships will be tested.

As the Great Library of Tomorrow prepares for a momentous celebration, Nu embraces both newfound love and her role as the Sage of Truth. However, if fresh nightmares prove to be the harbingers of Suttaru’s malevolent forces, romance must take a back seat to her responsibilities.

When a savage act sends shockwaves through the Great Library, the return of an old friend brings to light a hidden relic from the Book of Wisdom’s past.

To stop the enemy, the Sages must pursue multiple paths. For Nu and Robin, this means traveling the realms in search of a mysterious figure from long ago. Meanwhile, Veer and his companions brave a realm of darkness and despair, where even the strongest can become undone …

The post Tomorrowland Unleashes Second Novel, ‘The Sky of Sacrifice’ appeared first on EDMTunes.

items.title: Groove Cruise 2027 Returns to Amplified Allure of the Seas on Voyage to Brand New Royal Beach Club
items.description: Exclusive Takeover of Royal Caribbean’s Brand New Royal Beach Club, Home to the World’s Largest Swim-Up Bar For the fourth consecutive year, Groove Cruise will claim its title as the world’s largest floating music festival, embarking on its 39th sailing from January 21-25, 2027, taking captains (attendees) to an exciting new destination: the brand
items.fullContent:
Exclusive Takeover of Royal Caribbean’s Brand New Royal Beach Club, Home to the World’s Largest Swim-Up Bar

For the fourth consecutive year, Groove Cruise will claim its title as the world’s largest floating music festival, embarking on its 39th sailing from January 21-25, 2027, taking captains (attendees) to an exciting new destination: the brand new Royal Beach Club on Paradise Island. Groove Cruise is set to be one of the first private, chartered experiences at the Royal Beach Club. This dynamic beachfront area will feature the Floating Flamingo, the world’s largest swim-up bar, as its centerpiece, along with multiple pools, private beachfront zones, local island flavors, and curated chill and celebration spaces. During GC27, the entire destination will be reserved exclusively for the #GCFAM. Better yet, GC27 is returning to the newly amplified Allure of the Seas. The ship has been upgraded throughout and you can see all the changes here. You can reserve a cabin now for a $99 refundable deposit here! Use code edmtunes for a discount on your cabin.

On the heels of back-to-back sell-outs over 8 months before sailing, Groove Cruise isn’t a typical festival. It’s a life-affirming journey that blends music, adventure, connection, and transformation into something deeper. More than one hundred weddings and proposals have taken place at sea. Thousands of friendships, creative partnerships, and breakthroughs have started on board. Captains describe it as a family reunion with people they didn’t know they had.

The Next Evolution

GC27 will expand its transformational programming with the next evolution of The Groove Effect and the 8 Waves. This energetic roadmap guides captains through tuning their frequency, exploring curiosity, breaking comfort zones, owning their groove, entering flow, elevating others, sparking ripples of impact, and stepping into the infinite. It’s designed to help people return home changed in the best possible way.

Sailing from Miami, Florida, on January 21, Groove Cruise invites past Captains and new #GCFAM alike to indulge in a once-in-a-lifetime experience aboard Royal Caribbean’s Allure of the Seas, which just underwent $100 million renovations. The sailing will feature 96 hours of nonstop music and connection, as well as Groove Cruise’s signature immersive programming, which will include 13 stages of transformation, globally renowned artists, daily themes with dedicated parties, artist-hosted activities, beachside destination parties, the Whet Foundation volunteer experience, mental health panels, and so much more.

Awards Galore

Awarded Best Large Cruise Ship by GOLD Travvy Awards, Best For Entertainment by Cruisers’ Choice Awards, and Best Individual Cruise Ship by Readers’ Choice Awards, Allure of the Seas will be the most updated Groove Cruise ship to date and will be the biggest music cruise of any genre in history. Allure of the Seas is part of the Oasis Class of cruise ships, which is the largest ship class in the world with a length of over 1,187 ft, 18 total decks, and a full capacity of 6,780 passengers. With an original cost of $1.2 billion and a recent revamp of $100 million, the newly amplified Allure of the Seas boasts new covered favorites, including The Pesky Parrot tiki bar, resort-style pools, and the 10-story dry slide – the Ultimate Abyss.

Groove Cruise 2027 prices are listed below, with quad inside cabins starting at $999.

Groove Cruise Miami 2026 is sold out with a huge waitlist, aboard Royal Caribbean’s Wonder of the Seas, featuring over 100 world-renowned producers, performers, and DJs, including John Summit, Cloonee, Chris Lorenzo, Jackie Hollander, Linska, Max Styler, Skilah, and more. But captains can reserve their spot now for Groove Cruise 2027 with only limited $99 deposits remaining here. Use code edmtunes for a discount on your cabin!

The post Groove Cruise 2027 Returns to Amplified Allure of the Seas on Voyage to Brand New Royal Beach Club appeared first on EDMTunes.

items.title: OGGY Steps Into Her Own Light with “Another Dream”
items.description: Every so often, an artist appears with a story that grows layer by layer, lesson by lesson – until suddenly you realize they’ve built something with real gravity. OGGY, the London-based singer, songwriter, and actress also known as Olga Savic, is one of those artists. Her new single, “Another Dream”, is certainly the moment all [...] Read More... f
items.fullContent:
Every so often, an artist appears with a story that grows layer by layer, lesson by lesson – until suddenly you realize they’ve built something with real gravity.

OGGY, the London-based singer, songwriter, and actress also known as Olga Savic, is one of those artists. Her new single, “Another Dream”, is certainly the moment all the years of training, self-doubt, persistence, and late-night open-mic courage converge into a sound that finally speaks in her own voice.

OGGY’s journey didn’t begin with her debut single. It began long before, in private vocal lessons, in the halls of Kingston University where she earned her MMus in Music Performance, in the quiet discipline of learning guitar, piano, and ukulele, and in the slow construction of artistic confidence. Unfortunately, that confidence didn’t come easy. For years she struggled to believe she had anything singular to offer until a short songwriting course with Aidan Martin became a turning point. Melody and emotional honesty revealed themselves as her native language.

“Another Dream” carries the echoes of that. It’s a pop-rock release with the emotional voltage of Fall Out Boy, but its centre of gravity is unmistakably hers. The chorus (“Another dream come to end… A thousand dreams will die again”) sits at the intersection of longing and resignation, a place where love dissolves but the heart isn’t quite ready to follow. OGGY writes from lived experience, but aims for the universal: that pain of trying to hold onto something already flickering out. Such a complex feeling is hard to transcribe in music. OGGY does it with relative ease.

Since 2021, she’s been building her world through gigs at Dalston’s Mustache Bar, endless open mics, self-driven promotion, radio interviews, and blog features. And now, “Another Dream” is the next step. A sign of an artist who’s put in the hours, and an artist who is about to get the respect she deserves.

Stream “Another Dream” here.

The post OGGY Steps Into Her Own Light with “Another Dream” appeared first on Magnetic Magazine.

items.title: Stay hydrated, stay secure: a guide to festival-ready hydration and fanny packs
items.description: Between marathon sets, strict security checks, and packed crowds, the right bag can make or break your experience. Having gear that balances style, comfort, and security is crucial. Here’s what every festivalgoer should know before stepping through the gates. Hydration Packs: The All-Day EssentialA hydration pack isn’t just for storage, it’s surviv
items.fullContent:
Between marathon sets, strict security checks, and packed crowds, the right bag can make or break your experience. Having gear that balances style, comfort, and security is crucial. Here’s what every festivalgoer should know before stepping through the gates.

Hydration Packs: The All-Day Essential
A hydration pack isn’t just for storage, it’s survival gear for long days and late nights. The best festival backpacks keep your water cold, your valuables protected, and your shoulders comfortable. Look for at least a 2 liter hydration capacity, insulation, anti-theft compartments that rest against your back, and padded straps for comfort. RaveRunner has a number of hydration packs that stand out for combining both functionality and design, making them one of the go-to sources for seasoned attendees.

What to look for in a hydration pack:

  • Anti-theft design: The safest packs keep the main compartment against your back, making it nearly impossible for anyone to access while you’re dancing.
  • Hydration capacity: At minimum, you should look for a two-liter hydration pack so you can stay hydrated without constant refills that keep you off the dance floor.
  • Insulated or cooler-lined compartments so your drinks stay refreshing even after hours in the sun.
  • All-day comfort: Padded straps, breathable materials, and balanced weight are non-negotiable when you’re wearing it from gates to afters.
  • Festival-ready features: Bonus details like chest strap pockets give you a secure but easy-to-reach spot for valuables.

Hydration Fanny Packs: Compact, Secure, and Versatile
For instant access to your essentials on the dance floor, the hydration fanny pack is the perfect companion. They keep critical items like your phone, ID, and keys securely zipped against your body without weighing you down. Prioritize durable materials, tight zippers, and adjustable straps that can be worn crossbody or around the waist. RaveRunner’s hydration fanny packs deliver the comfort, flexibility, and anti-theft features you need for a worry-free night.

What to look for in a hydration fanny pack:

  • Durable materials that won’t rip or tear if someone tries to force their way in.
  • Secure zippers or buckles that stay closed even when you’re in the middle of the crowd.
  • Room for hydration: space to stash a water bottle or soft flask can make a big difference.
  • Comfy & Outfit-friendly: Find a pack that matches any look and is versatile enough to wear crossbody, around the waist, or slung over the shoulder.

Clear Bags: Staying Festival-Compliant
Clear bag policies are now the standard at most major festivals, but that doesn’t mean you have to sacrifice utility. Look for transparent bags that meet policy sizing, include hidden pockets, and maintain comfort. RaveRunner’s clear fanny packs and clear hydration backpacks let you breeze through the entrance, offering peace of mind and keeping you gate-ready.

What to look for in a clear festival bag:

  • Policy-approved sizing so you don’t get turned away at the gate.
  • Anti-theft details like hidden pockets and secure buckles, because clear doesn’t mean unprotected.
  • Comfort and versatility—the best designs let you wear them crossbody, as a sling, or around the waist without bouncing around.
  • Hydration-ready options for anyone who wants the benefit of a bladder system without sacrificing compliance.

Choosing What’s Right for You
Whether you need the capacity of a hydration pack, the quick access of a fanny pack, or a clear bag to meet gate compliance, choosing the right gear is crucial for a stress-free experience. Festival-ready bags keep your essentials secure, your hands free, and your focus on the music. Here’s some tips to help you decide what is right for you:

  1. How much do you carry?
    • If you bring layers, merch, or snacks, a festival hydration pack has you covered.
    • If you prefer essentials only, go for a hydration fanny pack.
  2. Do you need clear compliance?
    • Check the policy before you leave. A clear fanny pack or clear hydration backpack ensures you won’t be turned away at the entrance.
  3. What’s your comfort style?
    • Modular packs let you adjust—crossbody, waist, or sling—so you can dance without feeling restricted.

Featured image: RaveRunner

The post Stay hydrated, stay secure: a guide to festival-ready hydration and fanny packs appeared first on Dancing Astronaut.

items.title: Andromedik Triumphs: 4,500 Tickets Gone for ‘Ascension’ at Antwerp Expo
items.description: Belgium’s rising Drum & Bass star Andromedik is ready to take things to the next level. His long-awaited debut album Ascension landed on October 31. This followed by a sold-out 4,500-cap headline show in Antwerp on November 1 — his largest solo show to date. The night featured the world premiere of his brand-new A/V […] The post Andromedik Triumphs
items.fullContent:
Belgium’s rising Drum & Bass star Andromedik is ready to take things to the next level. His long-awaited debut album Ascension landed on October 31. This followed by a sold-out 4,500-cap headline show in Antwerp on November 1 — his largest solo show to date. The night featured the world premiere of his brand-new A/V show Ascension, bringing the album to life through a fully immersive visual experience. Ascension took nearly two years to create, born from a point where Andromedik’s songwriting and production hit new heights. The result is a body of work made not for algorithms or DJ tools, but for people seeking energy and emotion. The album takes listeners on a journey through Andromedik’s full spectrum: from nostalgic nods (Nothing Like You) to high-energy anthems (Stone or Air), emotional cuts (Feelings) and festival bangers (Sunlight).

Where my Rise EP set the tone, Ascension takes it all the way. This album shows who I truly am as an artist
– from emotional moments to pure club energy.

I wanted to prove that drum & bass can have real songs – with hooks, melodies and feeling – and still go hard


Andromedik (Axel Demarbaix)

High-profile collabs: Netsky, Kanine, Lauren L’aimant & more

Ascension features collaborations with some of Andromedik’s biggest inspirations and closest friends in the scene. A track with Netsky marks a personal milestone.

I’ve said in almost every interview that he’s (NETSKY) my biggest inspiration

ANDROMEDIK

Other guests include Kanine, Lauren L’aimant, returning for the lead single ‘Only One’. Comes after their earlier collab on ‘Air’ – plus Basstripper (BE) and A Little Sound (UK) on the standout tune ‘Sunlight.’

Andromedik Invites: His Biggest Solo Show

On November 1, Andromedik brought Andromedik Invites back to Antwerp Expo for his biggest solo show. They sold out all 4,500 tickets. The night delivered an explosive A/V experience powered by over 360m² of LED screens. The lineup was curated by Andromedik himself, featuring Camo & Krooked, Metrik, Emily Makis B2B Lens, Arcando and more. This edition also marked the world premiere of his new A/V show Ascension, designed to visually amplify key themes and moments from the album.

Stream/download here.

The post Andromedik Triumphs: 4,500 Tickets Gone for ‘Ascension’ at Antwerp Expo appeared first on EDMTunes.

items.title: Mathilde SPZ joins forces with Ayko and George to release their new single “Don’t Quit” on Langhewood Records
items.description: Norway’s dynamic artist and songwriter Mathilde SPZ joins forces with Italian DJ and electronic music producer Ayko and emerging talent George to release their new single “Don’t Quit” on Langhewood Records, arriving on November 21st. Mathilde SPZ is a commanding presence in the Norwegian music scene, having performed at major festivals including Øy
items.fullContent:
Norway’s dynamic artist and songwriter Mathilde SPZ joins forces with Italian DJ and electronic music producer Ayko and emerging talent George to release their new single “Don’t Quit” on Langhewood Records, arriving on November 21st.

Mathilde SPZ is a commanding presence in the Norwegian music scene, having performed at major festivals including Øya, Stavern, Slottsfjell, Pstereo, and Findings across multiple projects. In 2024, she lit up the stage at Melodi Grand Prix, Norway’s national Eurovision finals, with her electrifying performance of “Woman Show”. With a decade of experience as one of Norway’s most sought-after live performers, Mathilde’s master’s degree in live performance sets her apart as a unique force on the club stage.

A songwriter from a young age, Mathilde began crafting pop songs at just nine years old, but her heart lies in EDM, house, and dance music. Her solo career launched in 2022, and she quickly amassed approximately 70,000 monthly Spotify listeners with over 3 million streams to date. Her previous releases have featured on influential editorial playlists such as New Music Daily (Apple Music), New Music Friday (Spotify in Denmark, Iceland, Norway, and Finland), EQUAL Norway, and “Ny Pop.” Her single “Losing Game” has also been viewed over 130,000 times on YouTube. Mathilde continues to expand her reach with collaborations across the globe, bringing her explosive energy and powerful vocals to the international club scene.

Italian producer Ayko (Francesco Dogliani) brings his signature blend of melodic techno, house, and dance music to the collaboration. Drawing inspiration from 1980s British pop, Italo disco, and 1990s rave culture, Ayko has developed a sound defined by melodic depth, rhythmic complexity, and eclectic instrumentation. Beginning his career in Turin, Italy, Ayko has performed at legendary venues including Space, Sankeys, and Privilege in Ibiza. In 2021, he founded Langhewood Records, a UK-based independent label dedicated to original electronic music, which has become a platform for his releases and a nurturing ground for emerging artists.

The collaboration is rounded out by George, an emerging electronic music artist whose deep house and melodic house sensibilities complement Mathilde’s powerful vocals and Ayko’s rich production, creating a track that promises to resonate on both festival stages and dance floors worldwide.

The release of “Don’t Quit” is accompanied by a visually striking music video created using DREAMOTICA, the generative visual language developed by Emanuele Del Fio and Viktoria Blank. Translating the song’s message of resilience into imagery, the video becomes a hypnotic fusion of light, motion, and emotion, where sound shapes color and form. Each frame is born from musical stimuli and digital artistry, achieving harmony between technology and human sensitivity. Through this collaboration, Langhewood Records and the DREAMOTICA team present a groundbreaking audiovisual experience that merges music, art, and introspection, pushing the boundaries of contemporary visual storytelling.

The post Mathilde SPZ joins forces with Ayko and George to release their new single “Don’t Quit” on Langhewood Records appeared first on FindYourSounds.

items.title: Opal Drums Unveil Debut EP, ‘Sarsen Cinema’
items.description: *Featured Cover Photo Credit: Jon Furst Opal Drums have released their debut EP, Sarsen Cinema, following their debut singles, ‘Burning Hammer’ and ‘Sunset Hex’. This project is a collaboration between UK turntablist Jon1st and Denver electronic artist Mux Mool. They wrote the EP in studios located in Leicester and Denver. Sarsen Cinema shows how t
items.fullContent:
*Featured Cover Photo Credit: Jon Furst

Opal Drums have released their debut EP, Sarsen Cinema, following their debut singles, ‘Burning Hammer’ and ‘Sunset Hex’. This project is a collaboration between UK turntablist Jon1st and Denver electronic artist Mux Mool.

They wrote the EP in studios located in Leicester and Denver. Sarsen Cinema shows how the two artists connect and their interest in creating unique soundscapes. Their music merges instrumental beats with contemporary club music. It tells a story about the mysterious arrival of large, breathing monoliths that create visions for those who approach them.

Opal Drums brings out mesmerizing percussive and bass sounds that draws in listeners to hear more of Sarsen Cinema

In the EP, Opal Drums combines rich sounds and catchy melodies with strong percussion and bass. This mix captures mixed feelings about the monoliths: fear, awe, devotion, and curiosity. The single ‘Burning Hammer’ shows raw energy, while ‘Sunset Hex’ goes deeper into hypnotic bass. Together, these songs introduce the world of Sarsen Cinema, where sound becomes vision and each rhythm tells part of a larger story.

The title Sarsen Cinema highlights a connection between the ancient and the modern. “Sarsen” refers to the stone used in ancient monuments like Stonehenge, while “Cinema” represents storytelling and perspective. In this world, sound transforms into vision, and rhythm creates myths. The EP also includes additional tracks; the EP’s title track itself, ‘From The Grove’, ‘Ultraviolet’, and ‘Runes’.

What to expect from the duo in the near future

Opal Drums blends both artists’ styles and sees their process as a collaboration. They do not stick to one tempo or music genre. Instead, they create a unified sound that will lead to immersive live performances in 2026.

Overall, Sarsen Cinema is more than just an EP. It serves as a portal into a sound that is both old and new, mechanical and human. This marks the beginning of the Opal Drums story.

The post Opal Drums Unveil Debut EP, ‘Sarsen Cinema’ appeared first on EDMTunes.

items.title: Sam Feldt, MC4D, VIZE, and Aloe Blacc Join Together on Feel Good Festival Anthem ‘Hey Son’
items.description: ‘Hey Son‘ is the studio chemistry collision of a track between New York melodic duo MC4D, Dutch mainstay Sam Feldt, German hit machine VIZE, and soul powerhouse Aloe Blacc. The track is a brass-laced, big-room-leaning house record built for wide-open mainstages and sunset slots. If you loved Avicii’s ‘Wake Me Up’ you’ll love the bright […] The post
items.fullContent:
‘Hey Son‘ is the studio chemistry collision of a track between New York melodic duo MC4D, Dutch mainstay Sam Feldt, German hit machine VIZE, and soul powerhouse Aloe Blacc. The track is a brass-laced, big-room-leaning house record built for wide-open mainstages and sunset slots. If you loved Avicii’s ‘Wake Me Up’ you’ll love the bright and feel good track.

At its core is Aloe Blacc’s unmistakable voice delivering the simple but effective hook: “Hey son, I wanna show you how this world is beautiful.” Layered over punchy drums, soaring synth stabs, and a massive horn section, the track radiates uplifting energy that you know from the 2013-2015 era with a modern punch.

MC4D, the twin brothers stated: ‘Hey Son’ feels really special to us, not only because we’re collaborating with artists we’ve admired for a long time, but because the song captures the energetic music that got us into EDM in the first place. Aloe Blacc’s vocals and the powerful brass melodies create an energy that feels made for festival stages.” 

The massive track holds especially close to MC4D as they were first inspired to create music in 2013 after they heard ‘Wake Me Up’ by Avicii and Aloe Blacc.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by MC4D (@mc4dmusic)

The track holds close to the heart for Sam Feldt as well with the song dedicated to his own son.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Sam Feldt (@samfeldt)

Sam Feldt (Amsterdam, NL)
With over 7 billion streams and a career launched by the hit “Show Me Love”, Sam Feldt has established himself as a global front-runner in dance music. Through his Heartfeldt universe and collaborations with artists like Rita Ora, Tones & I, and Kygo, he continues to spread positive energy and inspiration through his music. 

MC4D (New York, USA)
The twin brothers behind MC4D have created a unique sound that fuses progressive and melodic EDM with elements of indie folk and Americana. With over 50 million streams, 150+ shows in 2024/2025, and support from some of the industry’s biggest names, MC4D are among the most promising acts on the international scene. 

The post Sam Feldt, MC4D, VIZE, and Aloe Blacc Join Together on Feel Good Festival Anthem ‘Hey Son’ appeared first on EDMTunes.

items.title: Alex Farell – “People Just Hop On Trends”
items.description: With plenty of love going out to Enrico Sangiuliano, we put rising hard-techno phenomenon Alex Farell through our revamped Q&A - diving into his journey, influences, and what’s ahead. Alex Farell is one of the UK’s youngest forces in hard techno and hard dance. Starting production at 12 and playing clubs by 14, he quickly rose from Liverpool newcom
items.fullContent:
With plenty of love going out to Enrico Sangiuliano, we put rising hard-techno phenomenon Alex Farell through our revamped Q&A - diving into his journey, influences, and what’s ahead.

Alex Farell is one of the UK’s youngest forces in hard techno and hard dance. Starting production at 12 and playing clubs by 14, he quickly rose from Liverpool newcomer to international standout. His early releases gained major DJ support and led to a viral Boiler Room debut at 16, followed by key signings with Teletech and standout tracks on Reckless, Taapion, HEKATE, and We Are The Brave. With major festival appearances and a debut album on the way, Farell champions the idea that age is no barrier to making an impact in electronic music.

Why music?

⁠I’ve always listened to music religiously since I can remember. My mum and dad always had music playing in the house so i always had a very good ear for it.

If you weren't making music, what would you be doing?

⁠I really don’t know, to be honest. I kind of gave up in school from the age of about 13. Once I found out what DJing and music production were, I think I kind of self-sabotaged myself, so I felt I HAD to make it as a DJ or producer, since I didn’t really have any other skills.

What's the best advice you’ve ever received?

Adapt or get left behind. In the climate of this scene, where everything is changing pretty much every few months, it’s easy to try to stick to one sound, but these days it doesn’t seem to work.

What sparks your creativity?

Hearing good new music is always very good for inspiration and creativity.

Who’s the next name everyone should know?

⁠MXGN - he is a crazy producer from Liverpool, my hometown, and he uses lots of analogue and live equipment in his productions.

Best moment in a club or studio?

My favourite moment in a club was probably my international debut in Maaschricht, Netherlands, when I was 15. It was just so crazy to be so young playing my music in a foreign country.

What's the worst job you’ve ever had?

⁠I have never had a regular job, which is kind of crazy. I’ve managed to make good money from music since I was about 14 through various means

How do you know when a track's finished?

I usually try to finish my tracks as quick as possible, that way I don’t get hung up on the small things. If you overwork a track, you will find that the original version is always the best and the purest.

How do you like to finish your sets?

I usually close with a big ravey tune - or something with a lot of emotion that people are gonna go home and remember.

What was your last day job before going full-time in music?

Like I said before, I haven’t had a job 

Which track do you wish you’d made?

Enrico Sanguliano - "Astral Projection".

What’s the easiest way to break into music?

Producing is the best way to break into music - nowadays anyone can DJ - it’s really easy with the technology. But producing is a completely different ball game and takes years to master.

What’s the worst track or set you’ve ever done?

⁠I don’t really think there is a worst set, I’ve probably dropped a set that isn’t up to usual standard. But I’ve never car crashed a set or anything.

How do you organise your music collection for your sets?

I just add a few new tunes each week I want to play and add them to my collection, which is really big now, then I just feel the vibe of the club and see what I think the crowd is looking for.

[quote align=right text="anyone can make industrial, it is so easy, and it sounds terrible. But some people like it, I guess. It just takes 0 talent to create"]

Recommend a film.

Human traffic

Recommend a book.

⁠I’ve never read a book, I don’t think

Favourite internet clip of all time, music or otherwise?

⁠Enrico Sanguliano dropping astral projection at WHP back in 2017 – goosebumps.

Who or what deserves more credit?

MXGN - he is a very underrated producer.

Who or what gets too much hype?

Industrial DJs and producers - anyone can make industrial it is so easy and it sounds terrible. But some people like it I guess. It just takes 0 talent to create.

What can’t you stop doing?

Producing.

What’s your guilty pleasure?

I don't really know?!

What’s your biggest regret?

I have no regrets can’t have regrets in life there is no point.

What would most improve your life right now?

Nothing, my life is great.

Collaboration: rich creative experience or pain in the arse?

Collaborations are a great experience to receive and give new knowledge.

What’s the key to a great DJ mix?

⁠Feeling the vibe of the room. If you are opening, don’t play a set full of bangers; you need to warm up the room first. The same goes for when you are closing: don’t play low-energy tracks, or everyone will leave.

How do you unwind?

After a weekend of touring, I like to go to the gym and go to the studio to unwind.

One bit of kit or software you can’t live without - and why?

⁠I can’t live without the FabFilter plugins.

Art or money?

Art. Always.

Which DJ / producer (choose accordingly) taught or helped you the most?

Sara Landry really helped me understand the scene and taught me many production techniques.

Favourite sportsperson ever?

Seamus Coleman.

Vinyl, USBs or laptop?

Laptop.

Strangest place you made a track or did a set?

⁠The strangest place I’ve made a track is probably in the backstage of Prty festival in Glasgow, I was on in 2 hours so made a quick idea hoping to open up the night with it and it ended up being a good fit so I dropped it and it went off!

Must-visit record store or studio?

Filth on Acid studio in Amsterdam.

What’s your biggest frustration in the music world?

My biggest frustration is probably people wanting to be DJs now for the attention. People just hop on trends, and when one dies, they hop on another. It’s stupid. They don’t wanna put in the hours but want everyone to know their name.

Favourite label and why?

Drumcode - it was probably the reason I started to produce techno.

What’s the hardest thing about making or playing music?

Making music can be very frustrating, sometimes you go in the studio and nothing will come but you have to keep trying over and over again.

What’s your motto?

Be grateful.

Name something timeless.

Enrico Sanguliano’s music

Drop a quick tip – best production or DJ advice in a single sentence.

Be unique

Complete this: At heart, I’m just a frustrated…

...nerd!

If someone heard your music or saw your set in a thousand years, what would it say about our time?

That it was sick…

Can music change the world?

100% music can change a lot, including the world

What are you listening to right now?

Enrico Sangiuliano 😊

What should everyone do before they die?

Go to a proper techno rave.

Find Alex Farell on Instagram.

items.title: Igloofest Montreal announces 2026 season lineup, expands into new Canadian city
items.description: Canada’s coldest festival is back — and bigger than ever. Igloofest has unveiled the full lineup for its flagship Montréal event, alongside the return of its Gatineau and Québec City editions, and the debut of a brand-new stop in Edmonton. Montréal’s 2026 edition will once again transform the city’s historic Old Port into a frozen... Read More ▸ Th
items.fullContent:
Canada’s coldest festival is back — and bigger than ever. Igloofest has unveiled the full lineup for its flagship Montréal event, alongside the return of its Gatineau and Québec City editions, and the debut of a brand-new stop in Edmonton.

Montréal’s 2026 edition will once again transform the city’s historic Old Port into a frozen playground for electronic music lovers, running four weekends straight from January 15 – February 7. This year’s lineup is stacked with both international heavyweights and local favorites, delivering a fiery soundtrack for the frigid months ahead. The opening weekend brings house-heavy headliners Disco Lines, SOFI TUKKER, and The Blaze, setting the tone for another unforgettable season.

Each following weekend ups the ante with performances from DJ Snake, Madeon, Elderbrook, Skull Machine — an explosive new bass project from Black Tiger Sex Machine and Kai Wachi – Max Styler, and a rare back-to-back set from techno queens, Nicole Moudaber and Montréal’s own Misstress Barbara.

Of course, Igloofest wouldn’t be Igloofest without showcasing the city’s thriving local scene. Collectives like Ferias and Homegrown Harvest return for stage takeovers, bringing the underground energy that defines Montréal’s dance music culture.

Once Montréal wraps, the Igloofest tour heads across the country — touching down in Gatineau (February 12–14), Québec City (March 6–8), and making its first-ever appearance in Edmonton from March 13–15.

Pre-sale registration opens November 6 at 11 a.m. ET, with general on-sale to follow November 7 via Igloofest’s official website.

Featured image: Alexis Monet

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Igloofest Montréal (@igloofest_mtl)

UNTOLD Dubai has officially revealed its full 2025 lineup, bringing a mix of global superstars and underground icons. Set to take over Dubai Parks and Resorts from November 6-9, the four-day festival boasts one of the most ambitious lineups the region has seen.

Headlining the mainstage are Martin Garrix, Armin van Buuren, Axwell, Alan Walker, MEDUZA, Steve Aoki, KSHMR, NERVO, Tchami, Salvatore Ganacci, Jaxomy, and Tujamo, with live performances from J Balvin, YUNGBLUD, Saweetie, and Swae Lee bringing even more star power. The festival’s renowned Zamna takeover returns to the Galaxy Stage, curating a world-class lineup led by Eric Prydz, Jorin Voorn, MRAK, Hot Since 82, and many more – rounding out a roster that spans every corner of the electronic spectrum.

Following its record-breaking debut last year, UNTOLD Dubai is ready to raise the bar again with six stages, over 100 artists, and four nights of cutting-edge production and pure energy in the heart of the Middle East. Tickets for UNTOLD Dubai 2025 are available now on the festival’s website.

items.title: “All The DJs” Marks a New Chapter for Patrick Topping
items.description: Patrick Topping joins Solid Grooves Records for the first time with his new single “All The DJs,” which arrived on 14 November 2025. It marks a major moment for both the UK producer and the label, bringing two highly respected forces in modern house culture onto the same release. Topping has shaped dance floors around [...] Read More... from “All T
items.fullContent:
Patrick Topping joins Solid Grooves Records for the first time with his new single “All The DJs,” which arrived on 14 November 2025. It marks a major moment for both the UK producer and the label, bringing two highly respected forces in modern house culture onto the same release.

Topping has shaped dance floors around the world for more than a decade, building a consistent track record through his Trick label, his global touring schedule, and a long list of singles that have become reliable tools for DJs across scenes and regions. His approach combines direct, functional production with personality, and this new release carries those same qualities.

Patrick Topping
Instagram / Soundcloud / Spotify

“All The DJs” centers around a focused arrangement that puts its rhythm section forward. The percussion drives the structure, the vocal line cuts through the mix, and the bass forms a steady foundation for peak club hours. Topping leans into a formula that highlights timing, contrast, and clarity, aiming for a track that performs reliably on large systems. The production style reflects his experience on international stages, where precision and impact matter as much as creativity.

Timing Is Everything On This One

The release also lands at a time when Solid Grooves continues to hold a key role in shaping the sound of clubs throughout Europe and beyond. For years the label has remained committed to a steady output built around strong dance floor identity and clear quality control. Inviting Topping onto the roster aligns naturally with that direction. The collaboration signals shared values around effective club music, consistency, and a commitment to pushing talent that connects strongly with crowds.

For DJs, “All The DJs” offers a straightforward, useful record that fits into a wide range of sets.

The vocal hook adds personality without shifting attention away from the rhythm. The low-end translation feels tuned for modern systems, and the arrangement leaves enough space for layering, filtering, and live transitions. It reflects the kind of record built through real-world experience rather than trend chasing.

Patrick Topping “All The DJs” dropped on Solid Grooves Records on 14 November 2025.

The post “All The DJs” Marks a New Chapter for Patrick Topping appeared first on Magnetic Magazine.

items.title: Cloonee Closes Out 2025 with ‘Vamos A La Playa’ on Hellbent Records
items.description: Above Image C/O @tdangy Cloonee is wrapping up a stacked year with a new single that brings a final hit of summer energy. ‘Vamos A La Playa’ landed on Hellbent Records on November 14, 2025, and it arrives at a moment when his momentum is already running high. The UK-born, LA-based producer has spent the [...] Read More... from Cloonee Closes Out 20
items.fullContent:
Above Image C/O @tdangy

Cloonee is wrapping up a stacked year with a new single that brings a final hit of summer energy. ‘Vamos A La Playa’ landed on Hellbent Records on November 14, 2025, and it arrives at a moment when his momentum is already running high. The UK-born, LA-based producer has spent the past twelve months unloading a steady run of singles that shaped charts and set the pace across the house scene.

Tracks like ‘Stephanie’, ‘Not Gonna Be Your Boo’, and ‘X-Rated’ each had their moment, with ‘Stephanie’ holding Beatport’s top spot for six straight weeks during the early stretch of 2025. Every release added fuel to a year defined by heavy touring, strong club reactions, and a growing crowd of fans who connected with his approach to rhythm, vocal placement, and arrangement.

‘Vamos A La Playa’ pulls from the same energy he carried across the summer. The track was a fixture in his Ibiza sets, where it consistently worked in open-air environments. Its tight percussion and vocal hook shape the core of the record, while the groove keeps things light enough to work across a full range of set times. Cloonee leans into simplicity here, focusing on elements that translate well across large crowds. It’s the kind of track that fits into peak-time runs but also handles daytime stages without losing impact.

A Snapshot of His 2025 Touring Year

This release also ties into a busy touring schedule. Cloonee spent the summer moving between Europe, North America, and key festival dates, keeping his sets centered around high-energy selections and strong crowd engagement.

That run continues into the fall, and ‘Vamos A La Playa’ drops right before his Cloonee and Friends takeover at Miami’s Factory Town during Art Basel. He also has an Australia tour on the horizon, which adds another layer to what has already been a long year of travel.

Each tour cycle has continued to feed into his releases, shaping how he tests new ideas and how he refines records before they reach streaming platforms. ‘Vamos A La Playa’ follows that pattern, arriving after months of real-world play and adjustments based on crowd response.

A Solid Closing Statement for 2025

With another headline moment on the way and a full release schedule building behind the scenes, this single acts as a clean close to 2025. Cloonee has built a strong year through consistent output, tight club records, and a touring schedule that allowed each track to find its place. ‘Vamos A La Playa’ continues that rhythm and sets him up well for whatever he decides to roll out next.

‘Vamos A La Playa’ featuring Miranda dropped November 14 on Hellbent Records.

items.title: Adesso Music taps rising Brazilian star Kess for ‘Over Again’.
items.description: São Paulo-born DJ and producer Kess has been flying the flag for her native Brazil with electric performances at some of the country’s top festivals, from Soulvision to Soulclub. As she continues to refine her irresistibly catchy and eﬀective tech house sound, which has taken her to labels such as House of Hustle, Nothing But, […] The post Adesso M
items.fullContent:
São Paulo-born DJ and producer Kess has been flying the flag for her native Brazil with electric performances at some of the country’s top festivals, from Soulvision to Soulclub. As she continues to refine her irresistibly catchy and eﬀective tech house sound, which has taken her to labels such as House of Hustle, Nothing But, and LW Recordings, Kess now makes her debut on Junior Jack’s Adesso Music with ‘Over Again’.

Driven by slamming percussion, no-nonsense basslines, and hooky vox samples, ‘Over Again’ immediately hooks dancers under its intoxicating spell. It’s a heavy-duty cut primed for sweat-soaked rooms and heads-down dancefloor moments.

Kess ‘Over Again’ drops via Adesso Music on 21st November 2025.

Instagram – Soundcloud – Spotify

items.title: Get ready to sweat: BYORN & Pawlowski’s ‘LA TEMPERATURA’
items.description: Belgian hard-dance and techno sensation BYORN teams up with French DJ and producer Pawlowski to unleash their new track, ‘LA TEMPERATURA’, on Tomorrowland Music. The track will make its live debut at the Atmosphere show in Antwerp Expo on November 14 and is set to ignite dance floors worldwide. Listen here to ‘LA TEMPERATURA’ by BYORN and Pawlowski
items.fullContent:
Belgian hard-dance and techno sensation BYORN teams up with French DJ and producer Pawlowski to unleash their new track, ‘LA TEMPERATURA’, on Tomorrowland Music. The track will make its live debut at the Atmosphere show in Antwerp Expo on November 14 and is set to ignite dance floors worldwide.

Listen here to ‘LA TEMPERATURA’ by BYORN and Pawlowski

The track merges BYORN’s atmospheric storytelling and hard-dance intensity with Pawlowski’s raw-school synths and driving techno, producing a bold and uncompromising fusion of their sonic worlds.

“This track came together in Miami, where everything just flows a little differently,” says BYORN. “We caught a moment — a Spanish vocal that hit right, a groove that wouldn’t quit. It’s not just about sound, it’s about energy, connection, and letting go. That’s what this record is for”

About BYORN
​BYØRN is a Belgian hard dance/techno artist known for his emotionally charged, uplifting sound. Blending hard-hitting rhythms with mythic and atmospheric storytelling, his music is designed not just to move bodies, but to shift states of mind. Inspired by themes of transformation and ancient symbolism, BYØRN creates tracks that feel both timeless and immediate. With over 20 million streams worldwide and a steadily growing global audience, BYØRN has established himself as a defining voice in the modern hard dance scene. In 2024, he was named Beatport’s best-selling hard techno artist—a landmark achievement that cemented his reputation as one of the genre’s most vital and forward-pushing artists. Whether on stage or in the studio, his vision remains the same: to create powerful, immersive experiences that transcend the dancefloor.

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/byorn.music/ 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BYORN.music 

RA: https://ra.co/dj/byorn 

Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/artist/6PNduxfJ9CVW1bVXU

Beatport: https://www.beatport.com/artist/byrn/1106234

About Pawlowski
​Pawlowski, a French producer and DJ, has established himself as a true outsider in the techno scene, known for his unique approach to both sound and visuals. From the very start, he has blended the raw energy of ‘90s raves with a futuristic vision, merging old-school synths and acid textures to craft a style that is unmistakably his own. His breakthrough came in 2019 with Future Legacy, a track that immediately caught the attention of techno and neorave enthusiasts. A year later, in 2020, he solidified his reputation with Demonic Dimension, a standout piece from the Possession project, which quickly became an essential anthem in the underground club scene. His productions, infused with cyberpunk aesthetics and the dystopian essence of Akira and Evangelion, immerse his audience in a world where past and future collide. Always pushing sonic boundaries, In 2023, Pawlowski signed a publishing deal with the prestigious KNTXT label, releasing Final Outsider, an EP that marked a new artistic chapter. In October 2024, he returned with Back with Another One, a collaboration with Fenrick, further cementing his status as a forward thinking artist. For eight years, his scarf was his signature, an enigmatic symbol inseparable from his persona. But in 2025, he chose to reveal himself, ushering in a new era in his career. This transformation was marked by a new EP with Fenrick, featuring Donne-moi le Tempo (Remix) by DJ Fou, a tribute to French club culture and his passion for genre blending. He also released Now is the Time with Johannes Schuster, further expanding his sonic horizons. From the shadows to the spotlight, Pawlowski continues to write his own legend.

The post Get ready to sweat: BYORN & Pawlowski’s ‘LA TEMPERATURA’ appeared first on FindYourSounds.

items.title: RÜFÜS DU SOL Set to Dominate Europe’s Biggest Stages in Record-Breaking 2026 Tour
items.description: Tickets are available at rufusdusol.com/live for select shows while supplies last. The Australian electronic powerhouse RÜFÜS DU SOL is gearing up to paint Europe in their signature blend of euphoria and melancholy ...
items.fullContent:
Tickets are available at rufusdusol.com/live for select shows while supplies last.  

The Australian electronic powerhouse RÜFÜS DU SOL is gearing up to paint Europe in their signature blend of euphoria and melancholy next spring, announcing what will be their most ambitious European tour yet. Fresh off a globe-spanning triumph that saw them command stages across four continents, the Grammy-winning trio is setting their sights on eight massive venues throughout Europe in Spring 2026, with British producer SG Lewis joining them for what promises to be an unforgettable sonic journey.

This isn’t just another tour announcement—it’s a statement. The band will take over London’s iconic O2 Arena, marking their largest UK headline show to date, and claim Amsterdam’s legendary Ziggo Dome, one of Europe’s most celebrated indoor venues. They’ll also make their mark at venues steeped in Olympic history, including Barcelona’s Palau Sant Jordi and Paris’ Adidas Arena, while bringing their immersive live experience to Madrid, Zurich, Berlin, and Brussels. The inclusion of SG Lewis as support reflects the band’s commitment to curating every moment of the evening, ensuring fans are captivated from the instant they walk through the doors.

The numbers tell their own story. The trio’s Inhale / Exhale World Tour has already moved over 700,000 tickets across North America, South America, Europe, and Australia, cementing their status as titans of the live electronic music scene. Their most recent European run saw instant sellouts of back-to-back nights at Barcelona’s Plaza Mayor at Poble Espanyol, Berlin’s Uber Eats Music Hall, and Amsterdam’s AFAS Live, plus packed houses at Paris’ Zénith and a triumphant headline slot at London’s Crystal Palace Park. Before they even touch down in Europe again, RÜFÜS DU SOL will storm through a dozen sold-out arena shows across their native Australia this fall, then ride that wave into South America for February and March dates spanning Argentina, Brazil, Chile, and Colombia—a direct response to overwhelming demand for their return.
